basics.name: Shaoor Munir
basics.label: 4th Year Ph.D. Student in Computer Science (Machine Learning, Privacy, Technology Policy)

education.institution: National University of Computer and Emerging Sciences

work.name: University of California, Davis
work.summary: Research to evaluate existing privacy-preserving technologies and development of new techniques to counter advancements in online tracking.
highlights: Analysis of existing technology policies and how they impact online privacy

work.name: ID Privacy, Inc.
work.summary: Creating privacy-preserving solutions for advertising use cases.
highlights: Worked on an internal RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) tool to keep track of evolving documentation for privacy standards

work.name: Lahore University of Management Sciences
work.summary: Worked in collaboration with academics from The University of Iowa and UC Davis to explore state of the art in Natural Language Generation and Natural Language Understanding.
highlights: Worked on exploring automated methods to attribute a synthetic text to its source language model
Collaborated with external and internal resources to work on projects related to news event detection and Urdu language text corpus

work.name: Northbay Solutions
work.summary: Worked on an internal Big Data Research Project making use of Kylo, Nifi, Apache Spark, and Amazon Web Services to create an end-to-end Data Orchestration and Transformation tool for organizations dealing with large amounts of unstructured data.
highlights: Worked as part of a team designing core framework with Java API endpoints for Data Lake management in Amazon Web Services

work.name: Systems Limited
work.summary: Worked as a trainee in the Machine learning and Data Science team.
highlights: Worked on an R&D project for an American bank, making use of Random Forests, SVM, Word2Vec, Doc2Vec to automatically categorize banking forms and extract useful data

work.name: TechJuice
work.summary: Managed a writer panel consisting of 15 writers, spread across Lahore, Islamabad, and Karachi.
highlights: Worked towards improving the editorial quality, hired and trained new writers to expand the existing team

work.name: TechJuice
work.summary: Wrote and published more than 450 articles with one of the largest technology media organizations in Pakistan.
highlights: Organized, managed, and carried out interviews for TechJuice 25 under 25 2017 and 2018 editions

ongoingResearch.name: From Wires to Webs: Are Online Trackers Wiretapping Web Browsers?
ongoingResearch.description: Mapping elements of wiretapping laws to technical mechanisms deployed by online trackers.
highlights: Conducting deep investigation of common wiretappers to understand their modus operandi
Performing large scale measurement to determine the prevalence of wiretapping on a sample of top websites

ongoingResearch.name: FP-Inconsistent: Detecting Evasive Bots using Browser Fingerprint Inconsistencies
ongoingResearch.description: Large scale analysis of bots that evade commercial bot detection services.
highlights: Application of adversarial machine learning approach to evade commercial bot detection services
Analysis of inconsistencies in bot fingerprints to propose enhanced detection by these services

publications.name: PURL: Safe and Effective Sanitization of Link Decoration
publications.summary: Analysis of the use of link decorations for tracking purposes in the face of third-party cookie blockage.

publications.name: Blocking Tracking JavaScript at the Function Granularity
publications.summary: Analysis and detection of mixed JavaScript code (scripts including both tracking and functional resources).

publications.name: Googleâ€™s Chrome Antitrust Paradox
publications.summary: Research to evaluate the influence of major tech companies on privacy policies.

publications.name: COOKIEGRAPH: Understanding and Detecting First-Party Tracking Cookies
publications.summary: Research on how third-party scripts running in a first-party context can misuse this privilege and track users across different sites.

publications.name: Through the Looking Glass: Learning to Attribute Synthetic Text
publications.summary: Analysis of different classification techniques to learn how to attribute text generated by a language model.

projects.name: Makhzan (Urdu Text Corpus)
highlights: Helped build an open-source standardized Urdu Text corpus to help advance Natural Language Processing in Urdu language.

projects.name: Writeprints (Python Package)
projects.description: A Python library to extract features from text for use in fingerprinting text to train attributors.
highlights: Used in the Through the Looking Glass paper

projects.name: K2 | Java, AWS (Data Lake Solution)
highlights: Helped develop an end-to-end Data Lake solution with a plug-and-play Java API for end users.

projects.name: Intelligent Mock Interviewer | Python, Django, OpenCV
highlights: An intelligent interviewer using OpenCV, SVMs, and Neural Networks to analyze an interview's audio and video to judge the interviewee's personality.

talksAndMediaCoverage.name: ProMarket
talksAndMediaCoverage.description: Covered my research on the use of Chrome by Google to engage in anti-competitive behavior.

talksAndMediaCoverage.name: IMDEA Networks
talksAndMediaCoverage.description: Presented a talk on safeguarding user data from storage and exfiltration by trackers.

talksAndMediaCoverage.name: The Register
talksAndMediaCoverage.description: Covered my research on online tracking through link decoration and detection of these link decorations.

talksAndMediaCoverage.name: Ad-Filtering Dev Summit 2023
talksAndMediaCoverage.description: Presented work on automatically detecting tracking link decorations.

talksAndMediaCoverage.name: DataSkeptic Podcast
talksAndMediaCoverage.description: Discussed first-party cookie-based tracking and countermeasures.

talksAndMediaCoverage.name: Ad-Filtering Dev Summit 2022
talksAndMediaCoverage.description: Presented an overview of the COOKIEGRAPH paper.

talksAndMediaCoverage.name: EACL 2021
talksAndMediaCoverage.description: Presentation on attribution of text generated by language models.
